casebody.data:
Cleveland Bar Association v. Sterling.

[Cite as Cleveland Bar Assn. v. Sterling (1998), 84 Ohio St.3d 268.]

(No. 98-1709 Submitted September 29, 1998 Decided December 30, 1998.) *270Hennenberg & Brown and Michael C. Hennenberg; and James Flaherty, for relator. Howard T. Sterling, pro se. Per Curiam.

Upon review of the record, we adopt the findings, conclusions, and recommendation of the board. We hereby indefinitely suspend respondent

*271from the practice of law in Ohio and order that he comply with OLAP requirements as a condition of his reinstatement. Costs taxed to respondent.

Judgment accordingly.

Moyer, C.J., Douglas, Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Cook and Lundberg Stratton, JJ., concur.
